subject: RE: [junit] Junit suggestions
msgSnippet: setUp() should not rely on anything happening in your tests. If it fails to setup resources then it should include asserts or fail statements since there is no
messageBody:
setUp() should not rely on anything happening in your tests. If it fails to
setup resources then it should include asserts or fail statements since
there is no reason to run the tests.

The tearDown() will be called when a test is done, on either success or
failure. If it wants to avoid generating failure messages while trying to
cleanup, it should wrap its cleanup code in a try block.

M. Erik Husby
